title: Poitiers
summary: Poitiers (/ˈpwɑːtieɪ/, UK also /ˈpwʌtieɪ/, US also /ˌpwɑːtiˈeɪ, -ˈtjeɪ/,[2][3][4][5][6] French: [pwatje] (listen); Poitevin: Poetàe) is a city on the Clain river in west-central France. It is a commune and the capital of the Vienne department and the historical centre of Poitou. In 2017 it had a population of 88,291. Its agglomeration has 130,853 inhabitants in 2016 and is the center of an urban area of 261,795 inhabitants.
